{{also|Um|UM|.um|-um-|'um|um-|-um|Appendix:Variations of "um"}}
==English==
{{wikipedia|Speech disfluency}}

===Etymology 1===
{{onomatopoeic|en}}.

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|en|umm}}, {{l|en|hum}}

====Pronunciation====
* {{audio|en|en-us-um.ogg|Audio (US)}}
* {{rhymes|en|ʌm}} (when stressed, or as a verb)
Used in [[rhotic]] dialects. Compare to British English {{m|en|erm}}.

====Interjection====
{{en-interj}}

# {{non-gloss definition|[[expression|Expression]] of [[hesitation]], [[uncertainty]] or space [[filler]] in [[conversation]]}}. See [[uh]].
#: '''''Um''', I don’t know.''
#: ''Let’s see... '''um'''... how about this?''
#* '''2002''', ''Newsweek'' (volume 140, page lxxx)
#*: It's a great test of the claims of open-source gurus, who say that a self-motivated community can outcode any team working for a single employer—like, '''um''', Microsoft.
# {{lb|en|chiefly|American}} {{dated spelling of|en|mmm}}
#* '''1963''', {{w|Kurt Vonnegut}}, ''Cat's Cradle'', Dell Publishing Co., Inc., page 65:
#*: "About the same, wherever you go," he agreed.
#*: "'''Um'''," I said.

====Verb====
{{en-verb|umm}}

# {{lb|en|intransitive}} To make the ''um'' sound to express uncertainty or hesitancy.
#* {{quote-book|en|2007|Michael Erard|Um... Slips, Stumbles, and Verbal Blunders, and What They Mean||136|Meanwhile, in the popular mind '''umming''' was simply a bad habit, akin to spitting or picking one’s nose.}}

===Etymology 2===
From {{inh|en|enm|um}}, from {{der|en|non|um}}, {{m|non|umb|t=around, about}}, from {{der|en|gem-pro|*umbi|t=around}}, from {{der|en|ine-pro|*h₂m̥bʰi|t=round about, around}}. Cognate with {{cog|ang|ymbe|t=around}}, {{cog|fy|om||around}}, {{cog|nl|om||around}}, {{cog|de|um||around}}. More at {{l|en|umbe}}.

====Preposition====
{{en-prep}}

# {{alternative form of|en|umbe}}

=====Alternative forms=====
* {{l|en|umb}}, {{l|en|umbe}}

===Etymology 3===
A Latin-script rendering of ''[[µm]]''.

====Pronunciation====
* Pronounced as ''[[micrometer]]''.

====Noun====
{{en-noun|um}}

# {{alternative spelling of|en|µm}}

===Etymology 4===

====Particle====
{{en-part}}

# {{lb|en|dated|sometimes|humorous|often|offensive}} {{n-g|An undifferentiated determiner or article; a miscellaneous linking word, or filler with nonspecific meaning; representation of broken English stereotypically or comically attributed to Native Americans.}}
#: ''He '''um''' Growling Bear. He '''um''' heap big chief.''
#* {{quote-journal|en|1871||Grand camp meeting on Bear River|The Keepapitchinin||3|“me heap brave—me talk to '''um''' white man so{{...}} me good injun, like '''um''' white man, ''mebbe so'', ugh!”|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=GEFOAAAAYAAJ&pg=PP3|volume=III}}

===Anagrams===
* {{anagrams|en|a=mu|-mu-|MU|Mu|mu}}

==German==

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|de|umb}}, {{l|de|ümb}}, {{l|de|üm}} {{qual|all obsolete}}

===Etymology===
From {{inh|de|gmh|umbe}}, {{m|gmh|ümbe}}, from {{inh|de|goh|umbi}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*umbi}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*h₂m̥bʰi|t=round about, around}}. [[Central German]] dialects show regular umlaut; the standard form is from [[Upper German]], where umlaut of ''-u-'' was often blocked before labials. Cognate with {{cog|lb|ëm}}, {{cog|nl|om}}, {{cog|en|umbe}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|de|/ʊm/}}
* {{audio|de|De-um.ogg|audio (Germany)}}
* {{audio|de|De-at-um.ogg|audio (Austria)}}
* {{rhymes|de|ʊm}}

===Preposition===
{{head|de|preposition}} {{tlb|de|with accusative}}

# [[about]]
#: {{ux|de|Es geht '''um''' den Kuchen.|inline=1|It's about the pie.}}
# [[around]]
#: {{ux|de|'''Um''' die Ecke|around the corner}}
# [[at]], [[by]] {{qual|when relating to time}}
#: {{ux|de|'''Um''' acht Uhr reisen wir ab|At eight o’clock we depart}}
# [[by]] {{qual|percentage difference}}
#: {{ux|de|Die Verkaufsmengen gingen '''um''' 6% zurück.|inline=1|Sales in volume has decreased by 6%.}}

====Derived terms====
* ('''''um''' + das'') {{l|de|ums}}

===Conjunction===
{{head|de|conjunction}} {{tlb|de|introduces a ''zu''-clause}}

# [[in order to]], [[so as to]]
#: {{ux|de|Wir sind gekommen, '''um''' zu helfen.|We’ve come ('''in order''') '''to''' help.}}

===Adjective===
{{de-adj|-}}

# {{lb|de|predicative|not attributive}} up, in the sense of finished
#: ''Werden dich in kurzem binden/ [[w:Erdgeist|Erdgeist]], deine Zeit ist '''um''''' (Friedrich von Hardenberg, ''Novalis'')
#:: We will shortly bind you/ Erdgeist, your time is up

===Adverb===
{{head|de|adverb}}

# [[around]], [[about]]
# turned over, [[changed]], from one state to another

==Icelandic==

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|is|umb}}

===Etymology===
From {{inh|is|non|um}}, from {{inh|is|gem-pro|*umbi|t=around, about}}.

===Adverb===
{{head|is|adverb}}

# {{non-gloss definition|used in set phrases}}
#: {{ux|is|Það er '''um''' að gera að sofa vel.|The important thing to do is to sleep well.}}
#: {{ux|is|Hvað er '''um''' að vera?|What's going on?}}
#: {{ux|is|Eins og '''um''' var talað.|As was agreed.}}

====Derived terms====
* {{l|is|vera um og ó}}

===Preposition===
{{head|is|preposition}}

# {{qualifier|with accusative}} [[about]], [[concerning]]
#: {{ux|is|'''Um''' hvað ertu að tala?|What are you talking '''about'''?}}
#: {{ux|is|Spurning '''um''' líf og dauða.|A question '''of''' life and death.}}
# {{qualifier|with accusative}} [[through]], [[around]], [[across]]
#: {{ux|is|Áin rennur '''um''' dalinn.|The river runs '''through''' the valley.}}
#: {{ux|is|Að fara út '''um''' gluggann.|To go out '''through''' the window.}}
#: {{ux|is|Vestur '''um''' haf.|West '''across''' the sea.}}
# {{qualifier|with accusative}} [[throughout]], [[over]], [[around]]
#: {{ux|is|Við förum '''um''' alla sveitina.|We'll go '''throughout''' the district.}}
#: {{ux|is|Hann var breiður '''um''' herðar.|He was broad '''across''' the shoulders.}}
#: {{ux|is|Hún hafði klút '''um''' hálsinn.|She had a scarf '''around''' her neck.}}
# {{qualifier|with accusative}} [[during]], [[for]], [[in]], [[at]]
#: {{ux|is|Hvenær gerðist þetta?'' - ''Þetta gerðist '''um''' sumarið.|When did this happen? - It happened '''during''' the summer.}}
#: {{ux|is|Ég fór '''um''' nóttina.|I went '''during''' the night.}}
# {{qualifier|with accusative}} [[approximately]], [[about]], [[around]]
#: {{ux|is|Pokinn er '''um''' fjórir kíló.|The bag '''around''' four kilos.}}

====Usage notes====
* Often used with phrases such as "''[[brjóta heilann]] '''um'''''".
*: {{ux|is|Ég er búinn að [[brjóta heilann]] '''um''' þetta alla nótt!|I've been racking my brain '''about''' this all night!}}

==Portuguese==
{{cardinalbox|pt|0|1|2|zero|dois|ord=primeiro|wplink=Um}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{l|pt|hum}} {{qualifier|obsolete}}

===Etymology===
From {{inh|pt|roa-opt|ũu|t=one; a}}, from {{inh|pt|la|ūnus|t=one}}, from {{inh|pt|itc-ola|oinos}}, from {{inh|pt|itc-pro|*oinos}}, from {{inh|pt|ine-pro|*óynos|t=one}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{a|Portugal|Brazil}} {{IPA|pt|/ũ/}}
* {{hyphenation|pt|um}}
* {{rhymes|pt|ũ}}

===Numeral===
{{pt-cardinal|f=uma}}

# {{senseid|pt|numeral}} {{l|en|one}}
#: {{ux|pt|'''Uma''' xícara de café|'''One''' cup of coffee|inline=1}}

====Quotations====
{{seeCites|pt}}

====Descendants====
* {{desc|idb|um}}
* {{desc|kea|un}}

===Article===
{{pt-article}}

# {{senseid|pt|article}} {{lb|pt|indefinite}} {{l|en|a}}, {{l|en|an}}
#: {{ux|pt|'''Um''' carro, '''uma''' casa.|'''A''' car, '''a''' house.|inline=1}}
#* {{RQ:mul:Rowling Harry Potter|pt-BR|6|page=186|text=Tenho '''um''' recado para você.|t=I have a message for you.}}
#* {{RQ:mul:Rowling Harry Potter|pt-BR|6|page=361|text={{...}} disse o professor com '''um''' sorrisinho {{...}}|t={{...}} the teacher said with a little smile {{...}}}}
## {{senseid|pt|plural article}} {{lb|pt|in the plural}} {{l|en|some}}; {{l|en|a few}} {{gloss|a small number of}}
##: {{ux|pt|'''Uns''' carros, '''umas''' casas.|'''A few''' cars, '''a few''' houses.|inline=1}}
##: {{syn|pt|alguns}}
## {{senseid|pt|a bit of}} {{lb|pt|with uncountable nouns}} {{l|en|a bit|a bit of}}
##: {{ux|pt|Comi '''uma''' pipoca antes de dormir.|I ate '''a bit of''' popcorn before going to sleep.}}
##: {{syn|pt|um pouco de}}
## {{senseid|pt|quite a}} {{lb|pt|usually in the feminine|pronounced slowly, emphatically and with a high intonation}} {{n-g|indicates that what follows is exceptional}}; {{l|en|quite|quite a}}; {{l|en|quite|quite the}}
##: {{ux|pt|Ontem de noite caiu '''''uma''''' chuva.|We had '''quite a''' rain last night.}}
##: {{ux|pt|Estamos comendo '''''um''''' churrasco.|We are having '''''the''''' barbecue.}}
##: {{syn|pt|aquele}}

====Quotations====
{{seeCites|pt}}

====See also====
{{pt-articles}}

===Noun===
{{pt-noun|m|uns}}

# {{senseid|pt|the digit 1}} The figure or digit "1": {{l|en|one}}.
#: {{ux|pt|O '''um''' parece o sete sem gravata no pescoço.|inline=1|The one looks like the seven with no tie at its neck.}}

====Quotations====
{{seeCites|pt}}

===Pronoun===
{{head|pt|pronoun}}

# {{senseid|pt|someone}} a person; {{l|en|one}}; {{l|en|someone}}

# {{senseid|pt|previously mentioned element}} Element(s) of a previously mentioned class: [[one]]; [[some]] (in plural).
#: {{ux|pt|Comprei '''uns''' e me decepcionei.|inline=1|I bought some and got disappointed.}}
